title: Webb Space Telescope detects universe’s most distant complex organic molecules

last_post.content:
JWST Sees Organic Molecules Ludicrously Far Away

Life on Earth depends on various organic molecules, many of which astronomers have detected in space. But now, JWST has seen them in a galaxy less than two billion years after the Big Bang. The detection was made using a gravitational lens, where a foreground galaxy acts as a natural lens to magnify the light from a more distant object. With this lens's help, JWST could differentiate between the infrared signals of dust grains in the galaxy and the hydrocarbon molecules.

https://www.eurekalert.org/news-releases/991479

Watching the public comment, it is clear that the authorities are not caught flat-footed this time: they seeded the beginning of the speaking list with people to represent their own interests. But interestingly, that isn't just cops listlessly reading pro-cop-city speeches; rather, several speakers have focused on defending the integrity of the mayor. In other words, the authorities now recognize the fight over Cop City as a crucial battlefield determining which politicians will retain legitimacy.

After the first few speakers on the podium, though, the remainder of the speakers are unanimously against Cop City.

title: How a titan of 20th-century journalism transformed the AP — and the news

last_post.content: When the nonprofit newsroom Baltimore Banner launched last summer, executives set the ambitious goal of 100,000 subscribers by 2025. Almost exactly one year later, they’re reporting they’re already well on their way. https://www.niemanlab.org/2023/06/how-a-titan-of-20th-century-journalism-transformed-the-ap-and-the-news/

Almost a full decade after I started full-time work in tech, private offices for engineers were still considered the ideal (see: https://www.joelonsoftware.com/2006/07/30/private-offices-redux/), which had been the ideal preached for years prior.

Today, open offices and, often, hoteling are the norm, despite extensive evidence that unstable, noisy, dynamic environments are less productive for software engineering and many related kinds of work.

The relentless march to commodify high-wage labor will continue until wages go down.

Registration for the @sti2023 conference is open https://www.sti2023.org/registration/.

The conference is hybrid and we charge different fees for on-site and online participants.

I'm especially happy that we're able to offer a much reduced fee for online participants from lower income countries, defined as group A and B countries according to the #Research4Life classification https://www.research4life.org/access/eligibility/.

We hope this will contribute to a conference that is more globally inclusive.

@cwts
